briefdescription.para: This is the default threads number, but you can choose up to 1024.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int seed, T *d_val)

memberdef.argsstring: (NodeType *target, const NodeType &val)

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &plyFilePath, const size_t idx)

briefdescription.para: extract a Node object from a .ply file defined by index idx, in the file, reprsent the line number of point coordiantes, it is computioanlly slow , not use in loops or other , just for single node extrcation, this method will be decapred in other versions

briefdescription.para: Draw a 2D sphere (plain circle) given radius, center, and color.

memberdef.name: drawFilledCircles

briefdescription.para: Draw a sample of point cloud nodes as 2D colored circles.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *filePath, int width, int height, const int *centersX, const int *centersY, const unsigned char *colorsR, const unsigned char *colorsG, const unsigned char *colorsB, int numCircles, double radiusRatio)
memberdef.name: savePointCloudImage

briefdescription.para: Draw and save a given 2D points cloud of nodes as an image.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *h_arrayNodes, int N, float *minX, float *maxX, float *minY, float *maxY)
memberdef.name: computePointCloudBoundBox

briefdescription.para: compute the 2d bound box dimension for 2d plotting scaling issues for N nodes elments the minimal block grid number is : (N + thredsPerBlock - 1) / thredsPerBlock; interblock synhonization , usen shared memory Thread 0 of each block updates the global min/max values using atomic operations note we cannot template the function with double , because cuda cannot use atomic operation for doubles , just for cuda computation cabolit >6.0 see: https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/atomic-functions-for-double-precision/9963 https://forums.developer.nvidia.com/t/why-does-atomicadd-not-work-with-doubles-as-input/56429 atomic operations is only supported by devices of compute capability 5.0 and higher.

xrefdescription.para: Use of Local Reductions per Block

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *h_arrayNodes, int numNodes, const char *pngFilePath, double scaleFactor=100, double radiusRatio=0.01)
memberdef.name: array2PointCloudImg

briefdescription.para: Draw and save a given 2D point cloud of nodes as an image, the data is given as a 1d host array of NodeType template objects.

parameterdescription.para: : zoom image coffienct

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *h_arrayNodes, int numNodes, const char *pngFilePath, NodeType *startNode, NodeType *endNode, int scaleFactor=100, double radiusRatio=0.01)
memberdef.name: array2PointCloudImgBound

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string plyFilePath)
memberdef.name: getPlyPointNum

briefdescription.para: Return the number of points stored in a .ply file.

memberdef.argsstring: (T *a, int N, T *b)
memberdef.name: enumerationSort

briefdescription.para: CUDA kernel for sorting a numerical array using the enumeration sort algorithm. Original implementation by: Meng Hongyu, Guo Fangjin, UCAS, China https://arxiv.org/pdf/1505.07605 Modified by: Wissem Chiha, 01-09-2024, using templates.

memberdef.argsstring: (NodeType *d_nodesArray, int N, int ax, NodeType *d_nodesArraySorted)
memberdef.name: enumerationSortNodes

briefdescription.para: CUDA kernel that sorts an array of nodes based on a specified axis. This kernel sorts the nodes in ascending order according to their value along the given axis (1: x, 2: y, 3: z).

parameterdescription.para: Device pointer to the array of nodes to be sorted.
Axis to sort by (1: x, 2: y, 3: z).
Number of nodes in the array.
Device pointer to the array where sorted nodes will be stored.

simplesect.para: the call of this kernel with ax = 3 and Node2d class has no effect, and it do not throw any error

memberdef.argsstring: (NodeType *nearestNodes, T *distances, const NodeType &node, const NodeType &otherNode, int k)
memberdef.name: updateNearest

briefdescription.para: Update nearest neighbors list if the new node is closer

memberdef.argsstring: (NodeType *d_sortedX, NodeType *d_sortedY, NodeType *d_sortedZ, NodeType targetNode, int N, int k, int range, NodeType *d_kNodes)
memberdef.name: computeKnnNodes

briefdescription.para: Computes the K-nereast neighoods of a given node in a device array structure , by sorting x, y, z attributes, without using the K-D tree this kernel should excute on 1 block, so the maxium nodes number sorted arrays is 1024.

parameterdescription.para: control the exploration range of the KNN, fixed , adjustee based on the point cloud distribution density , low for high dense data and high for low dense distrubution
should be < threadsPerBlock

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_nodesArray, int numNodes, const NodeType *nodeToCheck, int *status)
memberdef.name: checkNodeExsist

briefdescription.para: Checks if a given node exists in the device nodes array.

simplesect.para: This method will be deprecated in future versions.

we use atomic exchange to ensure thred safty writtin value to the we reprsent by : 0 FALSE and any other int the TRUE value, perform chek if only nly perform check if the index is within bounds and status is still false (0)

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType &node, const NodeType &targetNode, T *hfun)
memberdef.name: computeHeuristicDistance

briefdescription.para: heuristic function which computes the estimated cost to the goal node, starting from the current given node, it simply the euclidian distances or the manthetn distance could be used

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType &node, const NodeType &targetNode, T *p_cost_)
memberdef.name: computeNodeTrajectoryCost

briefdescription.para: Computes the trajectory cost metric starting from a given node. The objective function is: f(n) = g(n) + h(n), where g(n) is the path cost from the start node to the current node, and h(n) is the heuristic function value.

parameterdescription.para: The current node representing the position in the trajectory.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_knnNodesArray, int k, const NodeType *endNode, NodeType *d_sortedNodesArray)
memberdef.name: computeSortedNodes

briefdescription.para: sort the knn nodes based on path metric f(n) = g(n) + h(n) from the k nearest neighbor nodes. Each thread will compute the trajectory cost and then determine the node with the minimum cost.

simplesect.para: This function is designed to execute within a single block, no interblock synchinoziation is implemented

parameterdescription.para: array of k-nearest neighbor nodes of the current node to be checked. The maximum size is 1024.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_tarjNodesArray, int N, T *cost_)
memberdef.name: computeTrajectoryCost

briefdescription.para: Given a trajectory path represented by a device array of nodes, it computes the path cost: the Euclidean distance between the start and destination nodes. The start node is the first node in the array, and the destination node is the last node.

simplesect.para: Boundary checks are not performed; N is assumed to be within the array size range.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_trajNodesArray, int N, int k, NodeType *d_trajNodesArraySmooth)
memberdef.name: smoothTrajectory

briefdescription.para: soothing the distcreate computed trajectory, using either spline basis or bezier curves , or just normale interpolations.

parameterdescription.para: number of points or control points in the trajectory
number of the evaulation point of the new trajectory

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_nodesArray, int numNodes, NodeType *d_rootsArray)
memberdef.name: getRootNodes

briefdescription.para: Extracts nodes without a parent from an array of N nodes. Iterates over the input array, where each node has a p_node attribute (pointer to its parent). Constructs a new array containing only nodes where p_node == nullptr (i.e., no parent).

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_nodesArray, int N, bool *status)
memberdef.name: hasOrphanNodes

briefdescription.para: Given an array of nodes, checks if there are any nodes without a parent, referred to as orphan nodes. Each thread in each block checks its assigned node.

parameterdescription.para: The number of nodes.
A boolean flag to indicate if an orphan node is found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_nodesArray, int N, int chunkSize, int index, NodeType *d_chunkArray)
memberdef.name: getChunkArray

briefdescription.para: given an array of nodes, extracts the elements starting from chunkSize * index to chunkSize * (index + 1) and fills d_chunkArray with them.

parameterdescription.para: Type of the node elements.
The input array of nodes.
The total number of elements in d_nodesArray.
The size of the chunk to extract.
The chunk index to extract.
The output array to store the extracted chunk.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *nodesArray, int N, int chunkSize, int index, NodeType *chunkArray)
memberdef.name: getChunk

memberdef.argsstring: (const NodeType *d_nodesArray, int k, const NodeType *endNode, NodeType *d_bestNode)
memberdef.name: computeOptimalNode

briefdescription.para: Computes the best successor node based on path metric f(n) = g(n) + h(n) from the k nearest neighbor nodes. Each thread will compute the trajectory cost and then determine the node with the minimum cost. This function is designed to execute within a single block.

parameterdescription.para: Array of k-nearest neighbor nodes of the current node to be checked. The maximum size is 1024.
